trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> class contains a collection of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> objects.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.Add(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute)"></xref> method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to the collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to add.
The zero-based index in the collection where the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> was added.
attribute is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.AddRange(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute[])"></xref> method adds an array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> objects to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> to add to the collection.
attributes is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
A member of attributes is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) or a member of attributes specifies a modification operation other than Add.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.AddRange(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection)"></xref> method adds a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object to the current collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object to add to this collection.
attributeCollection is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.Contains(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute)"></xref> method determines whether this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object contains a specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object for which to search.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> is part of the collection; `false` otherwise.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.CopyTo(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute[],System.Int32)"></xref> method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
ArgumentNullException
`array` is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
ArgumentOutOfRangeException
`index` is less than zero.
ArgumentException
`array` is multidimensional
-or-
The number of elements in the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of the destination `array`.
InvalidCastException
The type of the source <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination `array`.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of array where copying begins.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.IndexOf(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute)"></xref> method returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object for which the index is returned.
The index value of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object, if found; otherwise, -1.
The method inserts the specified object into the at the specified index.
The zero-based index point, in the collection, at which to insert the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to be inserted into the collection.
value is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) or value specifies a modification operation other than Add.
index is less than zero, or index is greater than the number of elements in the object.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.Item(System.Int32)"></xref> property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object at the specified index.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
ArgumentException
You attempted to set the property to `null`.
The index value of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object at the specified index.
The method verifies that value is a object or specifies an add operation.
The object to evaluate.
This exception can occur under one of the following conditions:
- value is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
- value is not a object.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection.Remove(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute)"></xref> method removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object from the collection.
Exceptions
Exception
Condition
NotSupportedException
<xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttributeCollection> is read-only or has a fixed size.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryAttribute"></xref> object to remove.
